other_tests.findings: Examination revealed 21 glomeruli, with 19% globally sclerosed, 38% cellular crescents, presence of red-cell casts, and interstitial fibrosis.
other_tests.changes_over_time: The extent and severity of glomerular lesions were modest, with crescents and necrosis not as prominent, suggesting subacute or transient disease.

other_tests.findings: Initially revealed red cells, red-cell casts, and white-cell casts. Follow-up examination showed nondysmorphic red cells, and no cellular casts.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Progression from significant hematuria to nondysmorphic red cells indicated a change in source of bleeding within the urinary tract.

other_tests.findings: Two sets of blood cultures grew gram-negative rods.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Subsequent blood cultures were negative following antibiotic treatment.

other_tests.findings: Revealed mild bilateral perinephric stranding and diverticulosis with fat stranding, along with an abdominal aortic aneurysm (3.9 cm).
other_tests.changes_over_time: Increased perinephric fluid noted on repeat imaging without discrete abscess formation.

other_tests.findings: Showed normal ventricular function and no valvular calcifications.
